title: Sans serif used in NYT Magazine
content:
Hi everyone,

does anyone know the sans serif they use in the NYT Magazine?  
The recently changed and they have Times new Romans but another one as well.  
Does anyone know that typeface name and where i can find it?

Thank a lot.

Cristian

 [‹ Oberösterreichische Landesbibliothek](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122052335/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47592 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) ITC Typeface Collection wide sans caps - ITC Blair {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122052335/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47685 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cristian butcovich

comments.content: We don’t get the NYT Magazine here. So, maybe if you could post an image ...

For display type, New York Times Magazine uses custom versions of Stymie, Cheltenham and the latest addition, Sunday (designed by sometime-Typophile Eric Olson at Process Type Foundry).

[http://processtypefoundry.com/custom/sunday.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122052335/http:/processtypefoundry.com/custom/sunday.html "http://processtypefoundry.com/custom/sunday.html")

Which is the one you meant?

And maybe next time take the time to scan what you’re looking for and post it. I mean, if you expect us to do the effort to go hunting for your typeface, you could at least do your bit as well. :^/  
Thanks.

—

Yves  
_Head Moderator Type Identification Board_
